publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-4234 Malcolm Chisholm: Congratulations to The Junction—That the Parliament commends the Junction community health project in Leith for the superb work it has been doing with young people over the last few years; recognises its success in preventing health problems through raising young people’s awareness and self-esteem and empowering them to make informed choices about their health, and congratulates it on beating hundreds of other entrants to win an IMPACT Award in a competition run by GlaxoSmithKline in partnership with the King’s Fund.

S3M-4234 Congratulations to The Junction (lodged on 26 May 2009) Des McNulty*, Stuart McMillan*, Karen Whitefield*, Mary Mulligan*, Mr Frank McAveety*, James Kelly*, Cathy Jamieson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Jackie Baillie*, Jamie McGrigor*, Pauline McNeill*
S3M-4234 Congratulations to The Junction (lodged on 26 May 2009) Dr Richard Simpson*, George Foulkes*, Hugh Henry*, Robin Harper*

S3M-4234 Malcolm Chisholm: Congratulations to The Junction—That the Parliament commends the Junction community health project in Leith for the superb work it has been doing with young people over the last few years; recognises its success in preventing health problems through raising young people’s awareness and self-esteem and empowering them to make informed choices about their health, and congratulates it on beating hundreds of other entrants to win an IMPACT Award in a competition run by GlaxoSmithKline in partnership with the King’s Fund. Supported by: Des McNulty, Stuart McMillan, Karen Whitefield, Mary Mulligan, Mr Frank McAveety, James Kelly, Cathy Jamieson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Jackie Baillie, Jamie McGrigor, Pauline McNeill, Dr Richard Simpson, George Foulkes, Hugh Henry, Robin Harper
S3M-4234 Congratulations to The Junction (lodged on 26 May 2009) Sarah Boyack*, Gil Paterson*, Sandra White*, Cathy Peattie*
S3M-4234 Congratulations to The Junction (lodged on 26 May 2009) Marilyn Livingstone*
